page.title: 07DAIRYING IN TEST VALLEY
page.content: 650 dairy cattle are kept on Broadlands Farm.They are mainly Friesian cows.Each cow produces 550 l of milk a year,therefore every year all the cattle together produce 3.5 million litres.The cows are milked at 5 different dairy units situated all over the farm.Milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. The cows graze on natural & improved pasture near the river Test. Peas and feed wheat are also fed the stock,and in winter they are kept inside.Calves are raised in 2 young stock units.No beef cattle are reared commercially but a few bulls are kept for the owner The farm includes woodland which has much wildlife in it,such as deer,foxes squirrels,badgers,hedgehogs,birds and butterflies.A gamekeeper looks after the wildlife & hedgerows are preserved for it.
